BOOSTERS 31 - 33 expand Transports Attacked


FEDERATION COMMANDER: BOOSTER #31 - Includes all new ships: a Fast Naval Transport, a Small Armed Freighter, a Large Armed Freighter, a Kzinti Combat Tug, a Federation Express Fast Courier, a Tholian Cargo Patrol Corvette, and a Small Q-Ship.



FEDERATION COMMANDER: BOOSTER #32 - Includes all new ships: a Klingon T7 Combat Tug, an ISC Light Tactical Transport, an ISC Tug, a Vudar Light Tactical Transport, a Jumbo Freighter, a Large Q-Ship, and a Free Trader.



FEDERATION COMMANDER: BOOSTER #33 - Includes all new ships: a Lyran Combat Tug, an Andromedan Galleon, an Andromedan Caravel, a Romulan SparrowHawk-T, a Romulan Freight Eagle, a Squadron Scale Armed Priority Transport/Fleet Scale Small Freighter, and a Fleet Scale Armed Priority Transport/Squadron Scale Ore Carrier.


BOOSTERS 34 - 36 expand Reinforcements Attack


FEDERATION COMMANDER: BOOSTER #34 - Includes all new ships: a Federation New Escort Cruiser, a Klingon D5E Escort Cruiser, a Kzinti Medium Escort Cruiser, a Tholian War Cruiser Escort, a Hydran New Escort Cruiser, a WYN War Cruiser Escort, and a Vudar War Cruiser Escort.



FEDERATION COMMANDER: BOOSTER #35 - Includes all new ships: a Klingon G2 Police Cutter, a Kzinti Police Frigate, a Tholian Police Cutter, an Orion Medium Raider, an Andromedan Viper Frigate, an Andromedan Recon Cobra, and a Lyran Police Cutter.



FEDERATION COMMANDER: BOOSTER #36 - Includes all new ships: a Romulan Vulture Dreadnought, a Gorn Dreadnought Cruiser, a Gorn DNT Dreadnought, a WYN Heavy Battlecruiser, an ISC Heavy Dreadnought, an ISC Light Dreadnought, and a Vudar Heavy Battlecruiser.


Ship Card Packs


Ship Card Packs are themed by empire or type of ship and include six ships.


Expands:

Federation Commander: Klingon Border
Federation Commander: Romulan Border
boardgameversion: Booster Pack #0: Threat File and Intelligence Briefing
Booster Pack #10: The Battle of Zulu Station
Booster Pack #13: Battle of the Hook
Booster Pack #14: Assault on Base Station Three
Booster Pack #15: Raid on Base Station Four
Booster Pack #18: Titans of the Stars
Booster Pack #19: Lyrans Trap Hydran Raiders
Booster Pack #3: Border Patrols and Mercenaries
Booster Pack #8: The Battle of Tekezeal
Boosters Pack #91: The Ships of Joseph Franz
22093.name: Federation Commander:  Boosters

22094.name: A Book of Sandhurst Wargames
22094.description:
An large format book, measuring '9-3/4'-inches by '13-1/2'-inches with a slick-coated front & back cover. It has a general background article regarding gaming going on at the time of its publication (1982). There are extensive background materials related to the enclosed games. 64 pages, including rules for the various games contained within:


Aquitane - the Black Prince (a.k.a. Edward) goes on a war ride through France circa 1355~1356.
Craonne - a Napoleonic game of a Battle against the Russians in 1814.
Fjord - a Campaign level game of Arctic Convoys during WW-2.
Men Against Fire - a role-playing sort of game set in the WW-2 Pacific Theatre.


The game pack contains: 4 game boards and 4 printed sheets of playing aids (32 battle features; 476 die-cut counters; 16 playing cards; 3 personal aiming sheets)

22095.name: Lolli Plop
22095.description:
The game comes with two colored plastic 'lolli plops', about 8" high. The see-through lolli plops each contain 5 fully enclosed marbles, four black & one white. The aim is to shake the lolli plops until the marbles fall down the shaft.

The instructions come with a number of game variations.

22096.name: New Football
22096.description:
"New-Football" - this the new intellectual game! a variety of football, it is just as good as chess with the same creative potential.

It has captured something better that football has! the drama of the duel, the beauty of thought and the polish of maneuver.

22097.description:
Blue Moon: Buka Invasion is a Peoples expansion for Reiner Knizia's Blue Moon. The deck includes 31 new cards and is playable right out of the box against any other Blue Moon deck. They can be combined with other decks or cards by using the advanced deck building rules.

The devious pirates of the Buka invade the world of Blue Moon. Many cards can be loaded upon their ships to raid the opponent with unexpected force. And with the new "Bluff"-symbol a complete new concept enters the world of Blue Moon.
22097.name: Blue Moon: Buka Invasion

22098.name: NASCAR The DVD Board Game
22098.description:
From the manufacturer's website:

NASCAR The DVD Board Game combines the excitement of racing while testing players’ knowledge of one of the world’s most popular sports. Featuring a short and long track on a double-sided board, the DVD technology brings the excitement of a real NASCAR event into the home in 5.1 surround sound!

There are 15 unique race-simulating categories narrated by legendary NASCAR drive Bobby Allison with more than 350 on-screen challenges.

What's in the box?

Double-sided game board
DVD with 350 on-screen challenges
4 miniature stock car pawns
Instruction manual
Die
Driver's note pads and pencils

22101.name: Play it Again Juke Box
22101.description:
A unique board game which focuses on music lyrics from popular and rock music of the 50s, 60s, and 70s as well as music from movies, television shows, musicals, seasonal songs, and all time favorites. Unlike common trivia games, there are no question and answers, instead the terms non-question and non-answer are used. A specific song along with the first part of a lyric contained in that song, the year the song became popular, and the name of the performing artist is read to the player. The player then must complete the rest of the lyric from that song in order to advance his playing piece.

<The categories are: Beginning of rock and roll and popular music (1950-1963); British invasion music (1964-1979); Music from movies, TV, musicals, seasonal songs and all time favorites; Progressive rock and roll and popular music (1964-1969); New rock and roll and popular music (1970-1979); Beginning lyrics from any previously mentioned category

Includes gameboard, 90 discs containing 2,160 different non-question & non-answer lyrics in a black storage box, 6 disc holders for rotating discs, a fold able rack to display and hold disc holders during play, plastic storage bag for 6 plastic record holders, 30 plastic records, 12 scoring tokens, 1 6 sided die, and instructions.

22102.name: The Stupid Game
22102.description:
At the beginning of the game, each player places a randomly selected sign/label on their head that only the other players can see. This sign/label either says "I'm supposed to be stupid", "I'm supposed to be smart", "I can't win" or "I can't lose". Each player in turn moves one of their three playing pieces from a start position around a dartboard-shaped board.
The playing field has various colored and uncolored spaces on it. Movement is done by using dice rolls and following arrows on the board.
Every time the player lands on a colored space they must claim that space by performing a "Stupid Stunt" from the rule book. Failure to perform the stunts means the player must start over.
Each player is trying to land on either three spaces of the same color if they think they have a smart sign/label on their head or three different colored spaces if they think they have a stupid sign/label on their head. Once they get the three spaces they want they stand up and shout they are smart or stupid. If they are correct in their guess they win, if not they get a new label and start over.

22103.name: Steady Eddie
22103.description:
Eddie is a plastic seal with a spring balanced on his nose. On top of the spring is a large plastic ball with holes in it.

The instructions include several different Steady Eddie game variations. All however basically involve placing small plastic pick-up sticks in the holes in the ball without causing any sticks to fall.

22104.name: Miscellaneous Game Merchandise
22104.description:
This entry should be used to list, sell and trade miscellaneous boardgame related merchandise at BGG. Items can be anything a BoardGameGeek would collect which relates to the hobby. For instance: game catalogues, convention programs, flyers and tickets, game posters, stickers, etc. Basically any items produced by boardgame companies and related businesses used in advertizing or merchandizing. In other words, anything collectible goes here.

Note that boardgame magazines go under Miscellaneous Game Magazine.

Items used in boardgames themselves can either be submitted as expansions or included in Miscellaneous Game Accessory.

For items of role-playing merchandice see Memorabilia, Programs, Catalogs and Other Sundry RPG Related Material.

22105.name: The Bicentennial Games
22105.description:
A "Spirit of America" game. Three separate games recreating America's rise to independence. Game 1: Birth of a Revolution. Game 2: The Years of Crisis. Game 3: Independence. An officially licensed commemorative of the American revolution bicentennial administration.

There are two variations of play. In the first, the players just move across the board and collect points for being the first person to reach specific squares. In the second version the points are only awarded after the player successfully answers a history question. The paths across the board branch and reconnect allowing the players to choose a path that will offer them more chances for points or a speedier trip across the board. The boards are decorated with scenes from the American Revolution time period as well as historic dates and events.

22106.name: Black Gold
22106.description:
The maker Orofun Games of Littleton, CO calls this "The Oil Investment Game of Today." The object of the game is to earn the most money in a preset period of time. This is primarily achieved by income received from producing oil wells. The winner is the first player to collect $20 million dollars, or the one with the most money after time runs out.

The board is divided into 4 areas; Knife River, Apache Run, Big Muddy & Black Basin. Players roll the dice and travel around the board clockwise. As the player moves around the board, they collect oil lease cards and begin drilling for oil.

As play continues, the players collect pay day, which grows based on the amount of producing oil wells. They also can experience wells running dry, leases expiring, and they can purchase insurance. New years begin, they can face windfall profit taxes, receive golden oil drop cards, refinery bonuses, go bankrupt, and they may make deals amongst each other.

22107.name: Matti on maailman paras!
22107.description: Matti Nykänen is maybe the best ski jumper of all time. After a glorious sports career he has lived a really colorful life including numerous marriages, jail, booze, professional singing and lots and lots of other interesting things. After they made a movie about his life they also created this trivia game about his life. The name of the game translates into English as "Matti is the best of the world!"

22108.name: Pantheon and Other Roleplaying Games
22108.description:
Although labeled as roleplaying game Pantheon and Other Roleplaying Games does not have much to do with traditional concepts of roleplaying.

Players compete using their storytelling abilities to work through the plot, gain points by telling a genre-appropriate story and game uses bidding mechanic that pits players against each other.

Following originally from publishers website:

"Pantheon, puts five complete, ready-to-play RPGs in one 24-page book – all of them written by star author Robin D. Laws!

Pantheon uses a unique dice-and-counter story-telling system (the ‘Narrative Cage-Match’) to power its five games, including the action-horror 'Grave And Watery'; giant monsters smashing Tokyo in 'Destroy All Buildings'; and Pantheon itself where you play gods creating (or destroying) the entire universe. There’s something here for all gamers.

The game also has a stunning cover and terrific interior art from Frazer Irving."

22109.name: Leave It To Beaver Ambush Game
boardgamefamily: TV Series: Leave it To Beaver
22109.description: This is the 1959, Leave It To Beaver Ambush Game designed by the Beaver, Jerry Mathers himself.

22110.description: Four rows of points, placed opposite each other on an octagonal board, allowing two teams of two to play. Each team attempts to bear off all their team's checkers, while blocking the opposing team from doing the same. Modern BACKGAMMON rules are used.
22110.name: Doubles Backgammon

22111.description:
Double or Nothing is a fast paced, press-your-luck game that is perfect fun for groups of 3-6 players. How far will you push yourself to score points? Players take turns scoring or flipping over cards, looking to increase their points. Turn over the wrong cards and you will be out of the round.

The last player in the round is forced to play Double or Nothing which can lead to mega-points or nothing at all. Once the seventh bonus card is turned over the game ends and the person with the most points wins.
22111.name: Double or Nothing

22112.name: Mothers & Their Babies
22112.description: Pre-school game where children draw puzzle pieces and attempt to match the mother piece with the baby.

22113.name: Save the Forest Ecology Game
22113.description:
Take a walk in the woods and help the animals! What an important walk! Follow the path and see the rabbit jump, the bee buzz, the frog croak. Who can find the most animals? If you can find a tin can, bag or bottle cap, pick it up! Keeping the forest clean adds points to your score at the end of the trip.

Save the Forest teaches children about animals and their habitats, and gives a strong message about keeping the environment clean and respecting nature while having fun.

22117.description:
Join the race where good food sends you charging ahead, and junk food leaves you lagging behind.. Shows kids basic matching skills, and the benefits of a healthy diet..

Comes with: Game board, 1 spinner, 4 good food cards, 4 bear pawns, 20 star cards
22117.name: The Berenstain Bears Too Much Junk Food Game

22118.name: Doubles Checkers
22118.description:
From the publishers:

A game designed for two teams of two. The DOUBLES CHECKERS board is an octagon, gridded with eight parallelograms per side. The size and shape of the parallelograms adjust throughout the octagon to allow total coverage of the area.

The board contains 64 shaded parallelograms. Teammates sit across from each other, with opponents to the left and right. Diagonal movement, jumping, and kinging rules of traditional checkers apply in this game. However, the octagonal shape of the board causes the crowning rows to exist to ones left and right.

Players win by capturing or blocking from movement all opponents' pieces.

22120.name: Gargoyles & Goblins
22120.description: The board contains some hidden electronics which when two adjacent spaces are pressed will either cause the "Core Master" to light up and make noise - or not. Players move around the board and attack each other whenever they get next to another player by pressing down on both figures. If the "Core Master" goes off, then the defending player is removed from the board. Game continues until all but one player is wiped out. The surface of the board can rotate to a number of different positions so that the pattern of which spaces are active and which are not can be changed between games.

22121.name: The Okay Card Game
22121.description:
Featuring illustrations from Todd Parr's children's book "It's Okay," this simple memory game helps reinforce the idea that "there are LOTS of things that are, after all, OKAY!"

Players are each dealt five cards, and five cards are placed face up in the center of the playing area.

On a turn, a player closes his eyes while one of the five cards is turned face down. The player then opens his eyes and tries to remember which card is turned over. If the player remembers correctly, he may take one card from his hand and add it to the cards in the center. If the player guesses wrong, a card is added to the center from the draw pile. Either way, more cards are added to the center each turn, making it more difficult for players to remember them all. The winner is the first player to get rid of his original five cards.

22122.name: Fleeced!
22122.description:
Wallace and Gromit's cracking new sheep rustling board game! It's 'Shear' fun and frustration for all the family! Devised by Nick Park himself - the creator of W&G this promises to be huge fun.

Wallace & Gromit's Fleeced!: Sheep Rustling Game is a board game where players work their way around the streets seeking out fugitive sheep. Rustling them from their hideouts or from other players and herd them in long lines safely back home. But beware! Sheep rustling's a gamble! The more sheep you rustle - the more other rustling rascals will have their greedy eyes on your flock.

boardgamehonor: 2004 Australian Games Association Puzzle of the Year
2007 Spiel des Jahres Recommended
2009 Guldbrikken Best Adult Game Nominee
2009 Guldbrikken Best Adult Game Winner
22123.description:
Originally included with the Kaleidoscope Classic, a puzzle where differently shaped double-sided pieces containing one to eight squares are placed on an eight by eight-squared board in order to match one of many pre-selected patterns, Enkounter is now available as a standalone game.

In Enkounter players use differently shaped double-sided pieces containing one to eight squares in order to cover up a patterned board where each of the squares also has a value. The pattern on the piece must match the pattern being covered and points are scored for each square covered up and deducted at the end of the game for pieces not played.

Home Page: http://www.funkc.com
22123.name: Enkounter

22124.name: Transportation
22124.description:
The aim of the game is to become the wealthiest player by collecting as many goods as possible from the other five ports using vehicles and then to exchange the goods collected for payment. The faster you can get round the board - within the speed limits - the more money you can earn.

There are two types of goods, general goods (all one color) and dangerous goods (white with a colored cap). A player can only collect one item of goods per port visit and vehicles have capacity limits. Both types of goods cannot be carried at the same time. Dangerous goods also require a dangerous goods license.

At the end of the game the wealthiest player is determined by adding each player's total assets, including goods (at market value), vans and lorries (at value less finance costs), licenses, passes and contracts.

22125.name: Matchgolf
22125.description:
The aim of the game is to go round a 9-hole course in the lowest score using skill with 'a stroke of luck'.

Players start the game with a selection of cards representing various golf clubs. Each different club will produce a shot within a range of distances. There are also special cards including a 'hole in one' card. On the course there are 'hazards' and 'out of bounds' to be avoided. The course is negotiated using the starting cards and cards drawn during play. Putting cards are reduced in shots if the player is close to the hole. A player not using all of their starting cards during the round is disqualified.

Scores are kept on the score sheets provided. A full 18 holes can also be played after the caddy has redistributed the cards.

22126.name: Bag the Hun
22126.description:
From the publisher:
Rules for aerial conflict during the Second World War. Placing emphasis on the skills of the pilot in these easy to use dogfighting rules that do not need car aerials or aeronautical qualifications. In a dogfight your chances of survival depend heavily upon your ability as a pilot and the fighting qualities of your aircraft. Fly out of the sun to pounce on your unsuspecting opponent, and use your skills to keep on his tail, maximizing your chances of a kill. Abandon your wingman and suffer the consequences! The Bag the Hun system uses the TooFatLardies card based turn sequences to remove unrealistic predictability and allows you to fight actions involving up to 30 aircraft in an evening. All you need is a hex cloth and some planes.

22127.name: Give & Take
22127.description:
The players' goal is to be the first to surround the game board with their tokens. Spinner results determine whether players may place tokens on their track, block an opponent, etc. Rules include three versions: regular, advanced, and team play.

A 2002 Parents' Choice Approved Award Winner.

22128.name: Flip 'Em
22128.description: Players take turns flipping large chips manufactured from foam onto a 4x4 grid. Players are allowed to layer their own chips on top of opponents' chips. The object is to get three in a row. The game includes the 4x4 board and 64 chips in 4 colors.

22129.name: Find the Lady
22129.description:
Recommended for ages 8 to Adult

A game based on the Quadrant motion picture of the same title. A comedy starring: Larry Dane, John Candy, Mickey Rooney, Peter Cook, Dick Emery, and Alexandra Bastedo.

Follow the roads to the "Crazy House" and find the lady before your opponents. Fun for the entire family!

COMPONENTS:

Game board
Crazy House centerpiece
6 player tokens
6 plastic stands
6 "?" tokens (one with the Lady)
Die
Rules

22130.name: Summon the Dragon
boardgamepublisher: The United States Playing Card Company
22130.description:
An open bidding trump game designed so that you can't say, "I never get a hand I can bid on."

Has a custom deck of 53 cards, four suits (Earth, Wind, Fire, Water) of 13 cards (1-8, Mage Warrior, Queen, King, Elemental) and one Dragon card.

22131.name: The Muldoon Game
22131.description:
From the rules:
The MULDOON Game is for those who want to get away from the ordinary party chit chat; who want to let themselves go; and who want to gain a greater insight into the true personalities of those around them. So when you play the MULDOON game, sit down, relax, be honest to yourself...you'll have more fun.

"MULDOON: A person who is playing the MULDOON game. He remains a MULDOON until he reveals his identity to those playing the game with him."
"NOODLUM: A group of MULDOONS playing the MULDOON game. An ideal NOODLUM connsists of 6 to 12 MULDOONS."

A leader is chosen, each other player is given a sheet from the MULDOON pad. The leader then draws 10 question cards and reads them to the group. Players answer anonymously the questions. The leader will, then, read the answers. Players try to identify of the author of the answers, each correct guess is given 1 point. The winner is the player with the most points.

22132.description: Jockey - Corrida de Cavalos (Jockey - Horse Race) is a simple game of roll and move released by Big Toy, Brazilian publisher no longer in existence.
22132.name: Jockey: Corrida de Cavalos

22133.description: ATS Briefing Sourcebook #2 features 12 scenarios set in the 1948 and 1956 Arab-Israeli wars. This is an expansion to Advanced Tobruk and requires either Advanced Tobruk or another ATS game (for the rules) and purchase of a separate ziplock expansion containing the map, overlays and marker counters needed to play these scenarios.
22133.name: ATS Briefing Sourcebook #2

22135.name: Listening to Nature
22135.description:
Cock-a-doodle do, ring, ring, ...

What does this sound correspond to? Listen carefully to the tape and find out. A nice day is waiting for you. Are you coming for this excursion?

The players have to identify on the board the sound they hear on a cassette tape. The winner is the player who has identified the most sounds at the end of the game.

22136.name: Early Discoveries
22136.description:
Four children's games in one box.

What's for Lunch - Teaches children to identify five colors and shapes and four different animals.

Construction Crew - Children learn to identify geometric shapes without the aid of color.

Hurry Home - Teaches children the identification of people, places and occupations in a typical community and the objects normally associated with them.

Animal Galore - Children are introduced to simple strategy and use one to one correspondence to identity various animals.

22137.name: Spin for Sin
22137.description:
Players spin a spinner to select a category ("Sexy Sayings", "Gidgets and Gadgets", "Fantasies", "Hot Spots" and "Opponents Choice"). The opponent then draws a card with a phrase on it and must list out the number of words and letters with a series of dashes as if it were a game of hangman. The player then gets to select five letters of the alphabet, which the opponent must write in place in the phrase (if applicable). The player then gets an opportunity to guess the phrase. If successful, the player gets five points. If not, the player has the opportunity to select more letters, but decreasing the number of points awarded. The first player to 20 points wins, and is entitled to cash in a "Fantasy favor" check.

The phrases range from flirtatious to naughty but manage to avoid obscenity. This 'adult' game is for two, however there are references in the rules to "team" play as well.

22138.name: Gothic Line: The Battle of Monte Altuzzo
22138.description:
This is a new game in the Advanced Tobruk System (ATS) that allows gamers to recreate squad-level action in World War II. The Gothic Line was a German defensive front in Italy.

From the publisher's website:

A highly detailed rendition of this titanic struggle pitting combined-arms US Army forces against determined German resistance along the infamous Gothic Line in 1944.

IN EACH GAME YOU GET:
- A complete collection of color die-cut counters in 1/2”, 5/8” and 3/4” sizes,
providing the tanks, guns, and men that fought in the battle depicted;
- Detailed game maps on heavyweight stock;
- The latest edition of the ATS rules of play;
- Scenarios and Play Aids printed on separate heavyweight cards;
- Two ten-sided dice.

22139.description:
On a square wooden board of 9 x 9 squares each player has five wooden parts of a "castle": two angles on three squares and three cuboids on one square. So you have enough to build a castle of 3 x 3 of these parts. But. The starting position is not that easy: Two of your single towers are right in one corner of the board, trapped by the two angles of the opponent.
Winner is who first built a "whole castle" out of his 5 parts.
22139.name: Citadella

boardgamehonor: 2006 Golden Geek Best Family Board Game Nominee
2006 Spiel der Spiele Hit mit Freunden Recommended
2007 Golden Geek Best Board Game Artwork/Presentation Nominee
2007 Golden Geek Best Family Board Game Nominee
22141.description:
Designed by Bruno Cathala and Ludovic Maublanc, Cleopatra and the Society of Architects is a fun and engaging family game that includes a true, three-dimensional palace that players compete to build. Players strive to become the wealthiest of Cleopatra’s architects by constructing the most magnificent and valuable parts of her palace.

Players, however, will be tempted to deal with shady characters and trade in materials of dubious origins in order to help them build faster. While these corrupt practices might allow an architect to stay a step ahead of the rest, they come with a high price – cursed Corruption Amulets honoring Sobek, the Crocodile-god. When Cleopatra finally strolls into her new palace, at the end of the game, the most corrupt architect (the one with the most amulets) will be seized and offered as a sacrifice to her sacred crocodile! Only then will the wealthiest architect, from among those still alive, be selected and declared the winner of the game.

“The component design in Cleopatra is the most innovative we’ve undertaken to date,” said Days of Wonder CEO, Eric Hautemont. “While it’s still a board game, the dozens of 3D pieces – Column walls, Doorframes, Obelisks, Sphinxes, and Palace Throne – all create the sense that you’re constructing a royal palace.”

“The game play really forces players into continually weighing the risks and rewards between taking enough corruption to enhance your position in the game, but not so much that you are forced out of the game at the end,” said the game’s co-designer, Bruno Cathala. “It’s a classic ‘push your luck’ dilemma that continually raises the tension level higher and higher until the game reaches its climax.”

Description from the publisher.
22141.name: Cleopatra and the Society of Architects
boardgamepodcastepisode: Besprechung von Kleopatra und die Baumeister
BGB Volume 24 - Session Review with Great Wall of China, California, Toppo, and Cleopatra in brief with Chad Smith
BGWS 021 – Cleopatra and the Society of Architects
OBG 016: Down Time and Delay of Game
Quick Reviews and GrandCon - Episode 046
The Spiel #22 - You Bet Your Asp

22142.name: Kaaaos
22142.description: The players aim at trading the best series of cards from their opponents during a 30 second trading window, where everybody is taking part at the same time. So a lot of noise. If you get the wrong cards you'll have to go backwards on the board.

boardgamehonor: 2007 Golden Geek Best Wargame Nominee
22143.description:
Eastfront II is a update to the classic EastFront. It details the conflict between Germany and the Soviet Union during WWII. Players have to contend with production, supply, command control and weather to try and break the other side's lines. Individual, linkable 6-month scenarios cover the war from June 1941 through May 1945.

This title uses Columbia Games Block system, wooden blocks that stand upright with unit details only shown on one side, and rotate to take step reductions in strength. This provides a "fog of war."

EastFront II is part of a re-release of the entire EuroFront series; the new series consists of EastFront II, WestFront II, and EuroFront II.

EastFront II includes two maps: each 22" x 34" for a 44" x 34" playing area. The map area includes the Trans-Volga area, the Balkans, and Baku and Finland. All of the original EastFront scenarios are included and the larger playing area improves them.
22143.name: EastFront II
boardgamepodcastepisode: I've Been Diced! episode 31: Three player games
I've Been Diced! episode 44: Grant and Tom Dalgliesh on Columbia Games and the new, Kickstarted edition of Napoleon

22144.name: From Valmy to Waterloo
22144.description:
From Valmy to Waterloo is a miniatures game detailing warfare in Europe from 1792 through 1815. The game is divided into 2 parts, grand tactical and tactical. At the grand tactical level, the player is able to take on the role of Army Commander issuing orders to Corps and Divisions. At the tactical level allows for players to implement the orders of the Army commander. Written orders make up a very important part of the game.

Rules are somewhat complex, but once mastered give an accurate picture of conflict in the time period.

Game includes:


104-page rule booklet
56-page Army Lists and Scenarios booklet
18-page reference-sheet booklet
4 reference cards
2 template sheets (to be photocopied onto clear acetate)
1 orders sheet
2 half-sheets of counters


Scenarios:

Golymin 1807
Linz 1809
Wagram - first day 1809
Quatre Bras 1815

22145.description: 18xx set in the German province of Schleswig Holstein. It is a mixture of 1830: Railways & Robber Barons and 1835 plus some unique features for the Hamburg area. The game is available both in English and German either as kit or RTP.
22145.name: 1842: Schleswig Holstein

22147.name: Old Macdonald's Farm Game
boardgameversion: Early Learning Centre English First Edition
22147.description:
Be the first to fill Old Macdonald's Farm with animals.

Contents include a spinner, and 4 game boards each with 6 animal puzzle pieces that fit inside them.

The rules are very simple (the game is for ages 3+) and are included in their entirety:
To start the game each player is given an Old Macdonald Farm board. Press out the animal shapes and lay them out on the table in front of you. The youngest player then spins the spinner and takes the corresponding animal the pointer indicates. Play then moves clockwise to the next player in turn. If the spinner selects an animal that the player already has, the player doesn't pick up any animals. The first player to fill their Old Macdonald's farm is the winner.

boardgamehonor: 2002 Spiel der Spiele Hit für Kinder Recommended
22148.description:
Together the gnomes build a new village. They make houses with wooden stones in several colors. The die indicates in which color the next stone can be laid. But watch out for blue! That is the color of the kobold. And this small game spoiler makes his own blue tower which can fall at any moment and destroy the houses of the gnomes. The tension rises... who is fastest? The kind gnomes or the naughty kobold?

Kabouterstad (Gnome City) is a game where cooperation has been required and in which the players must help each other to finish the gnome city before the kobold builds his own blue tower.
The playing cards are printed on both sides. On the front a construction stands which must be reconstructed exactly. With the figure on the back we leave the fantasy of the children.
22148.name: Kabouterstad

22149.name: Negamco's Major League Baseball
22149.description:
A baseball simulation game that uses a 50-number spinner to select random events. Randomly selected numbers direct players to successive charts, in steps, for play results.
Game includes: spinner and playing field, team charts with individual player ratings for given years, score sheets, cumulative statistics forms, pitcher rating charts, stolen base chart, out chart, home run chart, sacrifice chart, out chart definitions, and stretch chart.

22150.name: Disney's Magical Moments Game
22150.description: Object of the game is to be the 1st player to earn six pieces of their character to complete it. Players earn pieces by correctly answering trivia questions about Disney movies.

22151.name: Vintage Wheels
22151.description: Vintage Wheels is a trivia game about automotive history. The game includes a game board, 1000 cards with questions and answers, 6 tokens, a die and instructions. Each player rolls the die on his turn to determine which question an opponent will ask him from a card. A correct answer allows the player to advance his token along a track the number of spaces indicated on the die. If a player answers incorrectly, play passes to the left. The first player to complete a circuit wins.

22152.name: Memory Lane
22152.description:
Do you remember Wiley Post, the Pierce Arrow, or the Zoot Suit? How about Xavier Cugat or Fay Wray? You will find all of these and more! The object is to get your teammates to identify as many "memorable" bits of history as possible in less than a minute.

Includes gameboard, playing pieces, 400 game cards, timer, and instructions

22153.description:
This is an Advanced Tobruk System (ATS) game allowing players to recreate squad-level action from World War II.

From the publisher's website:

-- The US Marine Corps is at it again as they struggle for Nishi Ridge. Complete game.
IN EACH GAME YOU GET:
- A complete collection of color die-cut counters in 1/2”, 5/8” and 3/4” sizes,
providing the tanks, guns, and men that fought in the battle depicted;
- Detailed game maps on heavyweight stock;
- The latest edition of the ATS rules of play;
- Scenarios and Play Aids printed on separate heavyweight cards;
- Two ten-sided dice.
22153.name: Nishi Ridge: The Battle of Iwo Jima 1945

22154.description:
From the publisher's website:

TOKTONG PASS—ESCAPE FROM CHOSIN is a detailed new ATS system game that tells the story of the Korean War from the perspective of the men of the 1st Marine Division, retreating from the Chosin Reservoir in the face of a massive onslaught by Chinese Communist troops. The Marines knew there was only one way out from Chosin, and that was to fight their way out, outnumbered and amidst some of the most hostile terrain on earth—harsh, hilly and frozen. The Marines could only bring their superior elan and small arms to bear against an enemy determined to annihilate every American soldier north of the 38th Parallel. Frostbite was an indiscriminate enemy while every hilltop captured by the Chinese had to be re-taken, every breach in the Marine perimeter repaired by force, without delay.

TOKTONG PASS—ESCAPE FROM CHOSIN delivers unheralded action and suspense at the scale and level of detail true tactical-level enthusiasts demand—individual squads, weapons and tanks. All the subtle nuances of small unit actions are provided by the acclaimed ATS system: gun duels; separate pivoting turrets; AFV indirect fire; coaxial machine-guns; melee; smoke; armor penetration; morale; AFV overruns; and much more. And it is all accomplished using a detailed yet intuitive system that models tanks using discrete armor values at turret, superstructure, lower hull and track aspects and front, side and rear facings. The ATS system provides for the realistic use of High Explosive and Armor Piercing ammunition. All this without the need for side notes or plotting moves and in a solitaire-friendly presentation.

BEGIN PLAY ALMOST IMMEDIATELY using the provided BASIC GAME RULES and TRAINING MAPSHEET that take moments to read and allows you to get your units down on the game map within minutes.

IN EACH GAME YOU GET:

* A complete collection of color die-cut counters in 1/2”, 5/8” and 3/4” sizes, representing the tanks, guns, and infantry that fought in the Korean War.
providing the tanks, guns, and men that fought in the battle depicted;
* A two part game box
* A colorful and accurate game map on heavyweight stock.
* The latest edition of the ATS rules of play;
* Scenarios and Play Aids printed on separate heavyweight cards;
* Two ten-sided dice.
22154.name: Toktong Pass: Escape from Chosin

22155.description:
This is a game in the Advanced Tobruk System (ATS) that allows players to recreate squad-level actions in the World War II era (1930s to 1950s).

A complete ATS game in a ziploc pits French paratroopers against Viet Minh in this famous battle.
IN EACH GAME YOU GET:
- A complete collection of color die-cut counters in 1/2”, 5/8” and 3/4” sizes,
providing the tanks, guns, and men that fought in the battle depicted;
- Detailed game maps on heavyweight stock;
- The latest edition of the ATS rules of play;
- Scenarios and Play Aids printed on separate heavyweight cards;
22155.name: Dien Bien Phu ATS Upgrade: French Indochina 1954

22157.name: Namutoni
22157.description:
On a board with 11 x 11 squares stands between the middle and one corner the fort NAMUTONI, built of 8 double-cube-sized cuboids: four corners/towers standing upright and four "walls" on the longer sides. So the fort has the size of a large 4 x 4 square enclosing 4 squares like a court.
From the two sides of the boards opposing the fort two players start from given starting points with four “tourists” to reach the fort.
The “tourists move in a kind of three-dimensional “knight-move”, so, after two steps on the same level it can jump one step vertically, or even after one step on the same level two steps vertically. This means that on the flat “desert” they have to cross first on their way to the fort, the figures are quite lame. For this there are four “helping stones”, which can be used as a stair. But you can not just put them wherever you want, but on the imaginary cross-points constituted by two movable strategic bars on the side of the board. Each of these bars contains three marks, so there are nine cross points where you can build “helping stones”.
In each turn a player can move one of his “tourists”, one “helping stone” or one bar to constitute new points.
The player who first enters the fort with three of his figures, one of them on a tower, is winning the game.

22158.name: Legendary Battles
boardgamefamily: Canadian Wargamers Group Miniatures Rules Series
22158.description:
Rules for using 25mm or 15mm miniatures to play Fantasy battles. Highlights include an extremely accurate point system for creating armies, streamlined rules with no exceptions or special cases, no die roll modifiers, and a movement stand system that combines the simplicity of stand-based movement (like DBA) with the detail of figure based combat (like Warhammer).

The expansion, Advanced Legendary Battles, adds Magic and Monsters, but is not as well edited or play tested.

22159.name: Muovaile ja arvaa!
22159.description: A team game in which players make figures out of plasticine and teammates try to guess, what the figures represent.

22160.description:
Eurofront II is an update to the classic EuroFront and adds the Northern Front, Middle East and Turkey not found in the prior version. It details the conflict between Germany and the Allies during WWII. Players have to contend with production, supply, command control and weather to try and break the other sides' lines. Several scenarios cover every major point of the war.

This title uses Columbia Games Block system, wooden blocks that stand upright with unit details only shown on one side, and rotate to take step reductions in strength. This provides a "fog of war"

EuroFront II is part of a re-release of the entire EuroFront series. The new series consists of EastFront II, WestFront II, and EuroFront II.

EuroFront II includes additional blocks for Finns, Swedes, and Norwegian forces as well as the Axis units that invaded Norway. Turkish and Iraqi troops are among new units for the Middle East.

Playing time: The stated 10 hour playing time is for a shorter scenario. A complete game takes 60-100 hours.
22160.name: EuroFront II
boardgamepodcastepisode: Advance After Combat 2016-04-02

22161.description:
Westfront II is the second edition of WestFront. It details the conflict between Germany and the Western allies during WWII. Players have to contend with production, supply, command control and weather to try and break the other sides' lines. Individual, linkable 6-month scenarios cover the war from June 1943 through May 1945.

This title uses Columbia Games Block system,wooden blocks that stand upright with unit details only shown on one side, and rotate to take step reductions in strength. This provides a "fog of war"

WestFront II is part of a re-release of the entire EuroFront series. The new series consists of EastFront II, WestFront II, and EuroFront II.

WestFront II includes two maps: each 22" x 34" for a 44" x 34" playing area. The map area spans all of western Europe from Spain to Norway. All of the original WestFront scenarios are included
22161.name: WestFront II

22162.name: Das wilde Fussball-Quiz
22162.description: Quiz game about Soccer published in "DIE WILDEN FUSSBALL KERLE" Series

22163.name: Double Cross
22163.description:
This is a game in the Waddingtons House of Games Family Favorites series.

This rather simple game features a square board with a track around the edge and with a cross track through the center. Squares on the track have a number from 30 to 100. Players are given 700 dollars to start and have a counter that starts in one of the corners. Game play consists of rolling a die, moving along the track and collecting money according to the color and number of the square a player lands on.

The game ends when one player wins all the money, but with some foresight, the game makers included an option to play the game to a time limit.

22164.name: Karee
22164.description: Up to four players collect animal tiles and attempt to cover these with 'gates' during the game. Uncovered tiles can be taken by other players. Winner is the player who accumulated the most loose tiles or "Karee's" (4 equal tiles).

22165.name: Alfa-Kubes
22165.description:
Alfa-Kubes comprises six dice with letters on each face; each letter has a value - as in 'scrabble'. The aim is to create the highest value word over 3 throws, keeping the dice you want and re-throwing the rest - as in Yahtzee or poker dice.

Simple, but infectious.

(Dating note: The box and rules are not dated. However, the place of manufacture is Harborne, England, where Chad Valley shifted production in 1920. Their Royal Charter mark, granted in 1936, is not printed on the box, so this edition of Alfa-Kubes must have been created between these dates. Hence this submission of 'c.1928')

Alfa-Kubes is a word dice game.

22166.description:
1869 is an 18xx-series game set in the western US, combining the 2D stock-market of 1830 with the an 1835-style fixed company opening order, wherein each 'group' of companies must be sold out before the shares of the next may be bought. 1869 also features one shares of variable sizes depending on the corporation, an idea obviously descended from Moon's 'Reading Variant' for 1830. There are also 'bonus runs' for some of the companies, which provides them with additional money for running trains between given cities.

1869 by Alan Moon is a game that is unlikely to see the light of day in published form, especially given its long (even for an 18xx game) play time. However, there are several copies of it circulating, and is played by (e-)mail by several groups.

UPDATE: As of July, 2014 this game is available direct (from Germany) via Marflow Games.
22166.name: 1869: USA West

22167.name: Beer College
22167.description: The game is to drink to graduate. Progress through a four year academic environment consuming a beverage of your choice as course work. Choose from a host of characters with different beer ranks to represent how aggressive you like to play the game. There are specific amount you will need to consume moving along the game path, however, you are given some latitude to drink at your own pace. The last guy that passes each final is assigned the amount in the communal glass. Interact with other players through playing cards that assign drinks, move players back and forth or perform other activities. Use the excuse cards to defend against drink assignments from others, either rejecting them or passing them to someone else.

22168.name: Ironclad
22168.description:
From the introduction: "Ironclad is intended to be a set of quick-moving, hard hitting rules, best suited for those who wish to sacrifice a certain amount of realism for the sake of the game. It is not intended to be comprehensive and cover every possible situation that could arise out of the U.S. civil war. It is, rather, a playable game... a framework around which you can build as elaborate set of rules as you wish."..."The game is extremely bloody."
The game is intended for 1:1200 miniatures on a table top of at least 3' by 5'. Each turn represents 5 minutes of real time, and ships move 1" (100 yards) for every knot of speed. Each ship gets a card with hit boxes for armor, speed, midships, stacks, draft, guns, and battering ram. A ship is sunk when all draft boxes are gone. Forts get similar cards.
The rules are only about 12 pages, plus a couple more for charts, pictures and background data. There are charts for penetrating and non-penetrating gunfire, critical hits, lucky hits, ramming, minefields, and loss of stack. There are also three different turning circles.

22169.description:
A new, stand-alone game with the same mechanics as Chez Geek. This time, the game revolves around "Reluctant Revolutionaries." Not completely compatible with other Chez games, but some cards can be used with the others, and vice versa.

112 cards, Art by Greg Hyland.
boardgameversion: Steve Jackson Games First English Edition
22169.name: Chez Guevara

22170.name: Shockoe: The Trivia Game of Metropolitan Richmond
22170.description:
This is a trivia game that has questions from around the Richmond, VA area. The introduction to the rules states:

Welcome to Shockoe! Enclosed you'll find 150 questions in each of five categories - Geography, History, Media, People and Variety - all related to Richmond. We hope that this game will serve several purposes. First, it is a game... a competition to see who knows Richmond best. Second, it is a hometown keepsake... a collection of Richmond where's, when's, and what's.

The questions in the game are a little outdated, having been made in 1985.

22171.name: Power Rangers Time Force Circle of Power Game
22171.description:
The Power Rangers Time Force is stranded at the outer reaches of time and space. They need to Save the World and they need YOUR help!

But there are obstacles... each Power Ranger must obtain a vehicle, escape a dimension rift, travel faster than the speed of time and finally capture the evil enemy, Frax. The first player to successfully blast through these challenges Saves the World and wins the game!

boardgameimplementation: Arkham Horror: The Curse of the Dark Pharaoh Expansion (Revised Edition)
22172.description:
Curse of the Dark Pharaoh is an Egyptian-themed expansion for Arkham Horror that contains 166 cards. It is a part of the Arkham Horror Series.

A museum exhibit has come to Arkham and can either stay as a permanent part of the base game (cards mixed in with original deck), or visit when you wish (cards kept separate).

The expansion contains: 45 Arkham location cards, 27 new gate cards, 21 new spell cards, 7 new ally cards, 4 benefit and detriment cards, 18 "barred from neighborhood" cards and 22 exhibit item cards, representing the ancient relics from Egypt.
22172.name: Arkham Horror: Curse of the Dark Pharaoh Expansion
boardgamepodcastepisode: ET70: Shub-Niggurath en el Wild Wild West.

22173.name: Great American History Games
22173.description: This book for teachers and home schoolers includes a variety of American history games, featuring a double-sided color poster for the board game Courageous Colony: A Colonial Survival Game (about colonial Jamestown). Other games include Muckracker: A Progressive Era board game, Hear Ye! Hear Ye A Revolutionary War News Game, Famous Quotation Bingo, State Capital Map game, Passport to American immigration game (based on Who Am I?), North or South? Civil War Fact Game, West Quest Timeline Game, Spy Versus Spy Civil War game, and more. The authors also have another book of 15 Primary Source Activities in American History, which makes creative use of primary source documents for mock trials, TV broadcasts, living tableaux, movie story boards, and other fun activities.

22174.name: Noun Hounds and Other Grammar Games
22174.description: A book of 20 games for elementary to middle school teachers or home schoolers to use with children. Noun Hounds (the title game) is an alphabetical board game about naming nouns. Other games: Command Performance (imperative verbs, acting), Subject-Verb Relay Race, Time Travel Word Maze (verb tenses), Black Hole Pronouns, Hinky Pinky Adjectives, Where's Herman preposition game, Pearls of Wisdom Auction, Compound Your Luck Game, Riddle Relay Race, Crack Me Up capitalization challenge, Word Jam concentration, Sound Sister Board Game (homophones), and more. The grande finale is the Drop Deadline Grammar Slammer Game.

22175.name: Poetryslam Magnetic Word Game
22175.description:
Martin Smith created POETRYSLAM MAGNETIC WORD GAME to experiment with language, poetry, and humor. It combines magnetic poetry with the concept of poetry slams and a 12x24 (magnetic) gameboard.

The game's word tiles will be familiar to anyone who knows magnetic poetry. There are nouns, verbs, adjectives, and endings. A miscellaneous category includes adverbs, conjunctions, pronouns, and prepositions. A rating assigned to each word reflects the difficulty of using that word in the magnetic poetry slam (1=easy; 8=obscure word) and doubles as the scoring mechanism.

Each player creates a line or a poem up to six words in length each turn. Second and subsequent lines/poems must include at least one word from those already on the board. The sum of the difficulty rating determines the score for the line or poem. The magnetic grid includes bonus cells, which add points to the play.

22176.description:
Lest Darkness Fall: Rome in Crisis is a strategic level wargame covering the third century crisis that beset the Mediterranean region and its environs. One player leads the Roman Empire and its client states, while the other commands an amalgamation of Rome's main enemies: barbarian Germanic tribes, Parthia, Palmyra and rebel forces from within the Roman world itself.

The second player is generally on the offensive, trying to invade, loot and occupy core Roman territory, or perhaps reach the city of Rome itself, in order to win. The Roman player wins by by finally maintaining the territorial integrity of the empire against the invaders.
22176.name: Lest Darkness Fall: Rome in Crisis, AD 235 – 285

22177.description:
Spot was asleep. Now he's awake and he wants to play this game!

Spot is always doing something. He is inside, outside, over and under. Whatever; wherever; however you look at it, Spot is fun! While playing the game, children match puzzle pieces to learn about opposites.
22177.name: Spot Opposites

22178.name: Girls Night Out
22178.description:
"Girls can get into enough mischief without any help from the likes of us but here's a pack of cards that will do just that. Over 50 new and outrageous dares that will have you dropping your inhibitions (or your knickers!)
So whether it's hen's night, birthday party or just messing around down the local, this pack of Girls Night Out cards is sure to make you weak with laughter and bring men to their knees...

She who dares sins"

This card game is a sequence of dares. Once a player completes a dare, she chooses who is to draw the next card. The player to complete the most dares in the evening is crowned Daredevil Queen of the Night.

22179.name: Race to the Gold Diggings of Australia
22179.description:
Race to the Gold Diggings of Australia, produced at the height of the gold rush in the min-1850s, is the earliest known board game devoted to Australia.

"In the game, children raced each other from Plymouth, in England, to Port Phillip, a stepping-off point in Victoria for those bound for the gold fields[...]" (National Library of Australia 2005, National Treasures of Australia's Great Libraries)

22180.name: Wake: Pacific Alamo
22180.description:
This is an Advanced Tobruk System (ATS) game allowing players to recreate squad-level action from World War II. This game focuses on the Japanese invasion of Wake Island in 1941.

From the publisher's website:

The Heroic stand, early-war USMC, Marine air and Japanese air and naval units depicted plus new counters for esoterica like American construction workers. THREE MAPS!

IN EACH GAME YOU GET:
- A complete collection of color die-cut counters in 1/2”, 5/8” and 3/4” sizes,
providing the tanks, guns, and men that fought in the battle depicted;
- Detailed game maps on heavyweight stock;
- The latest edition of the ATS rules of play;
- Scenarios and Play Aids printed on separate heavyweight cards;
- Two ten-sided dice.

Edit March 2016:

This is not a complete game. You do not get rules or information markers or dice.

22182.description:
This is an Advanced Tobruk System game that allows players to recreate squad-level action from World War II. This game focuses on the battles in France in 1940.


(from the publisher's website:)

A new ATS game designed on site by Pedro Ramis, French armor clashes with elite German troops in 1940. Amazing map, unique orders of battle. See Massive Char B1 bis French tanks smash through the gardens of Stonne. Researched locally, using French-language sources.
IN EACH GAME YOU GET:
- A complete collection of color die-cut counters in 1/2”, 5/8” and 3/4” sizes,
providing the tanks, guns, and men that fought in the battle depicted;
- Detailed game maps on heavyweight stock;
- The latest edition of the ATS rules of play;
- Scenarios and Play Aids printed on separate heavyweight cards;
- Two ten-sided dice.
22182.name: Stonne Heights

22183.name: CRISS-CROSS
22183.description:
This is a vintage game, made by KIM toys in the UK.
Dates from 1960's.

Contents:
A flimsy plastic board 6x6 with dice dots on each square
A dice
2x8 sets of markers

Object:
Each player tries to complete a row of six numbers in the same line on any direction.

Play:
Alternatively, players throw dice and put a marker on any square matching the dice outcome.
A "one" is a wild number.

22184.name: The OC Game
22184.description: A trivia game based on the Fox network show "The OC"

22185.name: The Gettysburg Campaign
22185.description:
In the Summer of 1863, General Robert E. Lee lead the Army of Northern Virginia deep into Union territory in hopes of capturing vital northern supply cities and forcing an early end to the American Civil War. The Union army, finding itself in the middle of yet another high level reorganization and command change after the debacle at Chancellorsville, was slow to respond. What followed was the largest and most important single battle of the war, and in American history.

But things could have been different. Find out how in this exciting new game from Deer Valley Game Company. Not another re-make of the Battle of Gettysburg; this game re-creates the entire Gettysburg Campaign - Lee's 1863 Summer Offensive. Now you are in charge!

This operational level game uses the block unit system to re-create the limited intelligance of the actual campaign. Players maneuver their forces without adequate knowledge of their opponents strengths or even location. The game board portrays the eastern part of the country, from southern Pennsylvania to northern Virginia, with a point to point movement system on a 30 x 22 playing map. Limited command abilities and critical supply wagons are key to managing your armies and achieving victory.

22186.name: Shako
22186.description:
A miniatures rule set for recreating Napoleonic battles. Supplemental rules also provide for recreating Seven Years War battles. Units are infantry battalions, cavalry regiments and artillery batteries. Infantry units with flank and rear support receive benefits in melee, which encourages Napoleonic linear tactics. Rules support large-scale battles well and the SYW supplement also works very well. Army lists are included with the rules and a book of scenarios is available.

Scenarios for these rules:

Fields of Glory

22187.name: Apina
22187.description: There are funny looking monkeys on the cards and players have to imitate those looks. But you also have to remember other players' imitations. If you fail to remember you're dropped.

22188.name: Swap! (2-10p)
22188.description: Players are trying to get rid of their cards playing cards matching the color of the last played card. There are special cards to change the color, swap your hand of cards with another player or rotate hands of all players. When Läiskis card is played other players must slam their hand on the discard pile as quick as possible.

22189.name: Mitä Missä Milloin Peli
22189.description: Mitä Missä Milloin (=What Where When) is a game series where there is a new trivia game coming out each year. The questions cover people and happenings of that year. Mitä Missä Milloin -books are an old Finnish concept that has provided the basis for these games.

22192.description:
HeroQuest Advanced Quest Edition (also known by the German version name "HeroQuest Master Edition") is Milton Bradley's approach to a Dungeons & Dragons-style adventure game. One player acts as game master, revealing the maze-like dungeon piecemeal as the players wander. Up to four other players take on a character (wizard, elf, dwarf or barbarian) and venture forth into dungeons on fantasy quests. Miniature plastic characters and doll-house style furniture make this game very approachable. Expansions were also released for this system.

The HeroQuest series consists of the main game and number of expansions.

HeroQuest Advanced Quest Edition adds 12 miniatures ("black guards") with 4 kinds of detachable weapons and a new 13 part adventure "The Dark Company" to the basic HeroQuest Box.
22192.name: HeroQuest Advanced Quest

22193.name: Wall Street Trader
22193.description:
From the back of the box:

Up to 4 Players!
Ages 12 And Up!

Think the Stock Market is a tough & risky game of high finance?

It is!!

Can you beat the odds?

WALL STREET TRADER will give you a grasp on the ways of The Market!

Make ultimate decisions, thrill to the enrichment of success...

challenging...
fun...
educational!!

- - - - -

The rules are printed on the back of the box top and seem to indicate a cross between a roll-and-move stock game (like The Stock Market Game from way back) and Stocks & Bonds (because you have to track holdings and value on paper). There are even special spaces like Federal Holiday, Quote Machine Down, and Telephone out of Service.

22194.name: Official Scorer's Basketball Game
22194.description:
From the back of the box:

Easy to Play - Ages: 8 through Adult - 1 or 2 Players

Realistic and exciting College Version Basketball Game which enables players to record each Field Goal, Free Throw, Rebound, Turnover and Foul just like in a real-life game. It's possible to be blown out or have a double overtime game. Unlike programmed electronic games, no two games will ever be alike.

Take your favorite team to the FINAL FOUR!!!!

It's great fun!!!

Game includes: Team Rosters, Scoresheet Pads, Game Instructions, Scoresheet Instructions, Game Scoring Pads, Dice, Dice Cup

- - - - - -

Now, after reading the instructions, here's how the game works.

Coaches choose their starting lineup and allocate the players to a position (two forwards, two guards, and a center). Then, they roll dice and confer with a standard results table (same table used for any team that plays--ie, there are no considerations for team or individual player talent level). Repeat this until game is over.

Hence, the game is not realistic in the sense that Clemson can beat UNC just as easily as UNC can beat Georgia Tech.

The box cover shows the logos of the then-eight teams in the ACC. Inside the box are all-star rosters for each of those teams (that is, players from different years play together), plus eight other teams (Georgetown, Indiana, Louisville, Marquette, UNLV, Notre Dame, St. Johns, and UCLA). For whatever reason, Abdul-Jabbar/Alcindor is not included on the all-time UCLA team.

That's about it. A basketball simulation with specified rosters, but you can list your own buddies names and get the same results when you take on the all-time all-star UNC Tarheels.

22195.name: Decapeg
22195.description:
Seems to be a variation of Yahtzee, themed for the track & field event--the Decathlon. Each player rolls four blue dice and two red dice five times in succession, locking in only 1 red die and any number of blue dice each turn.

The blue dice constitute the event (e.g. if you can get three 1s out of your 4 blue dice, you have qualified for the first event, the 100-meter run; if you can get two 3s and two 4s out of your 4 blue dice, you have qualified for the 8th event, the pole vault). Fail to qualify for one of the first 9 events (not matching one of the necessary patterns with the blue dice) and you can use your rolls as one leg of the 10th event, the 1500-meter run. In essence, these are free failure rolls.

The red dice, summed together, are your score for the particular event. So, if you lock in three 1s and any other blue die, after four rolls, you have rolled all 5 red dice. If your red dice are 6, 5, 5, 3, and 4 then you score 23 for the 100-meter dash. Any event with a score of less than 15 means you aren't Olympic caliber, so you don't even get to peg your score on the board...

Speaking of which, that's the "peg" part of the name. There is a cribbage-like board where players peg their event tallies.

22196.name: Think-n-link
22196.description:
Although the Milton Bradley logo appears prominently on the box, this is apparently a self-published or prototype game. No copyright or authorship information is included with the game.

The materials are hand-made. The box looks like a standard gift box with artwork pasted on. The box insert and game base are constructed of foam board; the building pieces are thin, hand-painted wood or fiberboard. There are three kinds of slats, all parallelograms. Large red slats are notched at the end, large green slats at the ends and sides, and smaller yellow slats are notched at the corners.

Per the instructions, three slats are inserted in slots in the foam base and then the players take turns building a structure, adding slats by mating the notches. If the structure falls or bends enough to touch the table anywhere but the base, the last player loses.

The notches are inconsistently cut, so it's nearly impossible to play - sometimes you can't get the pieces together, and sometimes they fit too loose.

boardgamehonor: 2006 Deutscher Lernspielpreis "3 years and up" Nominee
2006 Kinderspielexperten "5-to-9-year-olds" Nominee
22197.description: Kosmos´ next attempt to capture the crown of "Kinderspiel des Jahres" and from the same author as "Das Kleine Gespenst".
22197.name: Das Sams

boardgamehonor: 2006 Japan Boardgame Prize Best Foreign Game for Beginners Nominee
2007 Golden Geek Best Card Game Nominee
22198.description:
This game lets each player take on the role of a Northern Chinese prince. His task: the construction of a massive wall. His reward: Honor everlasting! To gain the honor, though, requires some sweat. The requirements are the same for each player. Each player has a set of cards in his color: seven wall cards (worth 1 point), three gate cards (worth 2 points) and one watchtower card (worth 3 points). Additionally, each player gets nine more cards of varying point value and which may also allow special actions to be carried out.

At the start of the game, each player shuffles his deck of 20 cards and places it face-down in front of himself. He then draws five cards from the deck. Now, depending on the number of players, 2 to 4 pairs of prestige tiles (with values from 1 to 8) are set out as the starts of card rows.

On a player's turn, he first checks to see if he has a point majority in any of the card rows. Then, he carries out two additional actions. He has the choice of either drawing another card from the deck or adding cards to one of the rows. The added cards must be identical. It is then the next player's turn.

If, when checking point totals, a player sees that he does have one or more majorities, then he chooses one of the prestige tiles and puts it onto one of his cards in that row. That prestige comes at a price: as long as the second prestige tile isn't claimed, the value of the prestige is subtracted from that player's total for that row. Once the second tile is claimed (which can be by the same player on a later turn), then both winning players set the tiles they won aside to score. Two new prestige tiles are revealed and the prestige for that row replenished.

The fight for prestige is also influenced by cards with special actions. For example, if a 'noble' card (1) is played, then the values of all cards in that row are reduced to 1. A 'dragon' card (1) can be played onto another player's card, neutralizing it. 'Cavalry' (2) are worth 2 points, and, equally valuably, do not cost an action. 'Infantry' (5) are strong in groups. A single 'infantry' card is only worth 1 point, but the next one is worth 2, and then 3, etc.

The game ends either when one player has played his last card or when the last prestige tile is taken. Afterwards, each player gets one last turn and then all card rows are resolved in turn order. The player with the most prestige at the end of the game wins. Players only receive prestige for tiles they have set aside for scoring. Tiles remaining on wall segments do not score.
22198.name: Great Wall of China
boardgamepodcastepisode: BGB Volume 24 - Session Review with Great Wall of China, California, Toppo, and Cleopatra in brief with Chad Smith

22199.name: Picture+ This
22199.description: Players form teams and try to score points for their teams by guessing the meanings of rebus picture-puzzles, representing items from the categories people, places, clichés, or TV/movies. One teammate is a clue giver and the others try to solve the puzzles within 45 seconds.

22200.description: Missing Match-Ups is a memory game with a Sesame Street theme recommended for ages 3-8. Plastic playing pieces are set up in punched-out holes in the game board to conceal a sheet with pictures underneath. Each player on his or her turn chooses two pieces to lift up, and tries to match the pictures underneath. If the pictures match, the player keeps the pieces which covered them and picks up two more pieces If the pictures do not match, the pieces are replaced and play passes to the next player. The player with the most pieces at the end of the game wins.
22200.name: Missing Match-Ups: Sesame Street

22201.name: Catch Zoboo If You Can!
22201.description:
Find the most matching pairs of Zoboo and his friends to win!

It's a basic memory game with a few twists. The game includes 48 game cards and a 2 1/2" painted, plastic Zoboo figure. In addition to the 16 pairs of animals, there are 16 extra tiles with the following special rules:
- 10 Take Zoboo Cards: When you get a pair of these, you get to take the Zoboo figure from the table or from the player who has it.
- 4 Lose a Pair Cards: When you get a pair of these, you lose ONE of the pairs you have. Return that pair and the "Lose a Pair" cards to the box.
- 2 Wild Cards: ANY other card you pick with this card (including Lose a Pair and Take Zoboo) becomes and instant pair!

After there are no more matches to be made, players count up all the cards they have. The player who has the Zoboo figure at this time adds an extra 4 points to their score. The player with the most points wins.

22202.name: Bowl-O-Rama
22202.description:
This is a simulation of Ten pin bowling. The game comes in a championship format with many (hundreds)of different bowlers and all with their own personal cards. There are two main types of play; One is to literally roll a twenty sided die down the cardboard lane into an area that gives you a result. Cross reference that result with the bowlers card to get a pin fall. The second type of play is to roll the twenty sided die and cross reference the number rolled with various charts.
There is a 'championship' mode and league mode as well as 'real' and fictional bowlers. A fun, short and accurate representation of the sport.

22203.name: Face To The Mat
22203.description: Highly detailed wrestling die and chart simulation. The game contains hundreds of wrestler cards that depict fictional and historical wrestlers. The game was further supported by additional 'wrestler packs' that add to the game. Tournament or league play. For enthusiasts of the sport primarily.

22204.description:
From back cover -
Over 130 never before published Car Wars vehicle designs - each fully described and illustrated
Over 100 option, and in-depth guidelines for customizing your own Stats for Sedan and Camper body types.
Comprehensive index of all the Car Wars vehicles ever published, from the first ADQ to the AADA Road Atlas and Survival Guide: Volume Four

Part of the Car Wars Series.

Expands:

Car Wars
22204.name: Car Wars Supplement, The AADA Vehicle Guide: Volume 2

22205.name: Trapture
22205.description:
Trapture is a 2-player strategy game in which players place "squiggle pieces" on the board to try and trap and capture (hence the name "Trapture") little purple pegs. If a player surrounds a peg on four sides it becomes theirs. Moves are also made to prevent your opponent from making captures.

Attention needs to be given to which pieces you are placing as you do not want to be stuck with pieces that do not fit.

22206.name: Tieto & Taito & Temppu
22206.description: The board shows pictures of all 365 days of a year. Each player starts from his or her birthday and tries to be the first to make a full circle. While going forward players are asked trivia questions, their mathematic and lingual skills are tested and they also have to make some physical exercises.

22207.name: Tempputorni
22207.description: In Tempputorni (=Tricktower) players enter different rooms in the tower. In each room there are inhabitants of the tower who make players do different physical tasks.

22208.name: Palanoppa
22208.description: Players are trying to find the right pieces for their jigsaw puzzles from the gameboard. After completing their jigsaw puzzles players also have to get back to square one first to win the game.

22209.description: Players are trying to find the key to the basement of the Moominhouse. They will also have to find a clamshell and two beautiful stones and return to the Moominhouse before everybody else in order to win.
22209.name: Muumipeli

22210.name: Trans-aktion
22210.description: Players buy up barrels of oil and try to sell these again for the highest possible profit. Whoever is the best at completing these transactions and owns the most money after a number of rounds is the winner of the game.

22211.name: Steppel
22211.description: Two players build rows of stones, each always connected by a so called "Steppel". The players constantly challenge each other and try to capture the opponent's stones. A single die and the player's wits and insight determine the winner.

22212.name: Kruisvuur
22212.description: Try to get your stones from start to finish as quickly as possible. Watch your opponent as he can capture your pieces. The die decides the number of positions you are allowed to move forwards (or backwards). The first to have crossed over his 10 stones wins the game.

22213.name: Patrouille
22213.description: Patrouille is a strategic game where each player tries to occupy the most strategic points. Tactical moves and some luck determine who can best overcome the obstacles and safely get his patrol to the target area and victory.

22214.name: Checkersaurus Rex
22214.description: Checkersaurus Rex is a game kit that contains two different games. The first game is simply Checkers, played with a collection of dinosaurs - with the Tyrannosaurus Rex miniatures used for the kings. The other game is a relatively trivial roll & move with some of the flavor of chutes and ladders combined with some childish goofiness: landing on the "Dino Stomp" square means the player must stand up and stomp about the table; landing on the "Dino Roar" square requires the player to emit a throaty roar; "Dino Food" is probably best not described, for fear of offending the sensitive reader.

22215.name: Truth and Triumph
22215.description:
A game to test your Christian knowledge. Based on the mechanics in Trivial Pursuit, players travel around the board answering questions in one of 4 categories - Old Testament, Wisdom, Life of Christ and Church Age (which is pretty hard when it comes to the post New Testament questions!).

Expanded by:

Truth and Triumph: Challenge Edition

22216.name: Meer, Minder, Gelijk
22216.description: This game teaches children the meaning of the terms 'more, less, equal' and is derived from Domino. Special dice determine which pieces may be added. Through the easy to grasp symbols, colors and rules, children learn effortlessly while playing.

22217.name: Het "Woord in Beeld" Spel
22217.description: This is a game of building words formed by placing pictogram tiles on a board. First 29 tiles are drawn and placed on the board to form the pool from which the player can select tiles. As long as time allows, a player may draw tiles and place them on the edge of the board in order to form the longest possible word.

22218.name: Twist Tac Toe
22218.description: It's really just tic tac toe but after your turn you have to rotate the rod that you just played into. So if you don't pay attention, you could turn up your opponent's color and give them the win.

22219.description:
Turm & Wächter (Tower & Guard) is a simple abstract 2-player game that is played on a 7x7 grid. Each player starts with 7 Tower-stones and 1 Guard-stone. The aim of the game is to use these stones to capture your opponent's all important Guard-stone, or to occupy the starting position of this stone with your own Guard.

Each turn a player can move one stone, or one stack of stones. How far (forwards, backwards or sideways, but never diagonal) is determined by the height of the stack. It is possible to move only a part of a stack if you don't want to move the full possible distance, but it is not allowed to jump over any other stones in this path. A move can end on a friendly Tower-stone or -stack, but Guard-stones can never become part of a stack.

It is possible to capture enemy stones by landing on them, under certain conditions. Guard-stones can always land on any enemy stone or stack and likewise, anything can land on the enemy Guard-stone. A tower-stone or stack can capture enemy stones or stacks only when it at least matches the height of the opposing stack. All Tower-stones that are captured are removed from play and as stated before, taking the enemy Guard-stone is one way of two ways to win the game.
22219.name: Turm & Wächter

22221.name: K'DOR
22221.description:
Material: 1 wooden gameboard and 24 wooden pieces.
The two players in turn set down one piece on the board until one of them can no longer play.
It is forbidden to place two pieces of the same color on two neighboring squares linked by a canal. They must be separated by at least one square.
The winner is the one who sets down the last piece.

22222.name: Imagine
22222.description: In this storytelling party game, you try to get points either by hiding randomly drawn words in your own story well enough or by finding those words in your opponents stories.

22223.name: Alphabattle
22223.description: Two players write down a 6-letter-word behind the word hatch on a plastic word panel and take turns trying to guess the opponents words by guessing a certain letter. The opponent answers with "lower" or "higher", which is "marked" with arrows on the panel to help find the word.

22224.name: Pairs or Better
22224.description:
From the back of the box:

"The object of the game is to collect cards to form a five-card poker hand by landing on designated squares along the edges of the board, and then to exit the game. The player to exit a hand worth two pairs or better ends the round and wins half the pot; the holder of the highest hand wins the other half."

"Pairs of Better uses the YOUR WAY playing system which provides highly interactive play with all players in competition right to the end."

According to their web site, all the inventor's profits go towards helping emerging opera artists, by way of supporting the Canadian Opera Company Ensemble Studio!

22225.name: Parole
22225.description: Two players attempt to make a chain of words and cross the board. Your adversary can and will try to break the chain and steal your words. Whoever reaches the other side of the board despite this handicap, wins the game.

22226.name: Race Across
22226.description:
Race Across is a puzzle game. A battery operated car (which can operate at two speeds) starts at one set of flag posts and you place tiles that cause the car to turn and twist through a maze you build to get to the finish line.

Designed to be playable by 5+ with fairly big chunky colorful tile pieces.

22227.description:
No Prisoners is a wargame covering the Suez-Palestine-Arabian Theater of Operations during World War I.
